title: Easy Garlic Kale Recipe
description: This kale recipe is deliciously quick to make by sauteing chopped kale leaves with sizzling garlic. Even kale-haters in the family will ask for more!

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Fruits and Vegetables Vegetables Greens Kale Easy Garlic Kale 4.6 (102) 76 Reviews 26 Photos I love kale, but my husband hates it. Cooking it quickly with olive oil and minced garlic is the only way he'll eat it! Submitted by WHIRLEDPEAS Updated on January 17, 2025 Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen Tested by Allrecipes Test Kitchen The Allrecipes Test Kitchen staff are a team of culinary pros who make and vet recipes using only equipment you'd find in a home kitchen. Staff credentials vary but include training at the Culinary Institute of America; kitchen stints in fine dining restaurants; and countless hours in the test kitchen itself. Meet the Allrecipes Test Kitchen Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 26 26 26 26 Prep Time: 7 mins Cook Time: 8 mins Total Time: 15 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Jump to recipe Add a delicious pop of color to your plate with this 3-ingredient kale recipe that comes together in just 15 minutes. If it sounds too good to be true, try this crowd-pleasing side dish for yourself ‚Äî you'll be shocked at its simplicity. Easy Garlic Kale Ingredients This recipe for kale is incredibly easy to make with just three ingredients: KaleChoose sturdy kale that's evenly green and free of yellow or brown spots. The leaves should be crisp and unwilted. GarlicA teaspoon of minced garlic adds just the right amount of flavor. You can keep it simple or add salt, pepper, and/or other seasonings to taste. OilThe kale is cooked in olive oil until bright green and tender. How to Prepare Kale You'll need to thoroughly clean the kale before you cook it. To prepare kale for cooking, simply soak the leaves in a large bowl of water until the grit sinks to the bottoms. Lift the leaves out and repeat the process with clean water if they're particularly dirty. What you do next will depend on the recipe. For this one, immediately discard the stems and chop the kale into 1-inch pieces. How to Make Easy Garlic Kale You'll find the full, step-by-step recipe below ‚Äî but here's what you can expect when you make this incredibly easy garlic kale recipe: Heat olive oil in a skillet. Stir in garlic and cook until sizzling. Add kale to the skillet, toss, cover, and cook (tossing occasionally with tongs) until the kale is tender and vibrant green. How to Store Cooked Kale Let your leftovers cool to room temperature, then place them in a shallow airtight container. Store in the fridge for up to five days. Eat the kale cold, microwave it in 10-second increments, or reheat it on the stove. Learn more: How to Store Kale Allrecipes Community Tips and Praise "I liked the simplicity of this recipe," says Allrecipes Allstar thedailygourmet. "Great side and fast to make ‚Äî no changes other than using kale that was already rinsed...it made preparation that much faster." "I will make it again," according to Clare. "I added plain pasta and a sprinkling of mozzarella and Parmesan cheese to make it a complete meal." "This is such an easy quick way to fix such a delightful vegetable," raves Rebecca Mitchell. "My whole family loved it! I used Cajun seasoning instead of salt and pepper because I was serving it alongside Cajun-style fried fish." Editorial contributions by Corey Williams Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 bunch kale 1 tablespoon olive oil 1 teaspoon minced garlic Directions Gather all ingredients. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Soak kale leaves in a large bowl of water until dirt and sand begin to fall to the bottom, about 2 minutes. Lift kale from the bowl without drying the leaves and immediately remove and discard stems. Chop the kale leaves into 1-inch pieces. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat; cook and stir garlic until sizzling, about 1 minute. Add kale to the skillet and place a cover over the top. Cook, stirring occasionally with tongs, until kale is bright green and slightly tender, 5 to 7 minutes. Dotdash Meredith Food Studios Enjoy! DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS¬† I Made It Print 419 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Easy Garlic Kale 01 of 26 Photo by¬† DOTDASH MEREDITH FOOD STUDIOS¬† 02 of 26 Photo by¬† Tammantha Shaw 10/25/2023 This taste really good, I put some broccoli ü•¶ in it, and some onions chopped, and cooked, and seasonings,I tried the recipe because I didn't have certain ingredients for another recipe, so I cook this recipe, and it was really good. 03 of 26 Photo by¬† DREGINEK 07/17/2023 A very simple recipe - and simple is good!! I made as written but next time, will take some other reviews into account - such as some different (spicier) seasoning and/or adding some Parmesan or even perhaps some orzo. Is this good?? Yes! Is this wow? For me and my husband- no. But!!! We did enjoy it with the rest of our dinner. Thank you WHIRLEDPEAS! 04 of 26 Photo by¬† Bertha Davis 09/08/2020 05 of 26 Photo by¬† Maria Perez 03/05/2020 06 of 26 Photo by¬† JessicaNdan Story 02/09/2020 07 of 26 Photo by¬† Melernea Neff 01/05/2020 08 of 26 Photo by¬† Kelly Gallardo 01/03/2020 Next time I plan to add some caramelized onions and some pepper. This was super easy to make. I don't normally get kale but signed up for a produce box subscription and it had a couple of bunches in it, along with fresh garlic. So this easily fit the bill. I plan on making it again. 09 of 26 Photo by¬† Kelly Gallardo 01/03/2020 Next time I plan to add some caramelized onions and some pepper. This was super easy to make. I don't normally get kale but signed up for a produce box subscription and it had a couple of bunches in it, along with fresh garlic. So this easily fit the bill. I plan on making it again. 10 of 26 Photo by¬† gloria 12/07/2019 Will make it again. I don't think leaves we're wet enough so came out a little dry. Will do it again. Practice makes perfect.
